Summary of logistic regression with one two-way interaction term

s_logistic_interaction.Rd

Summary of logistic regression with one two-way interaction term

s_logistic_interaction(glm_model, conf_level = 0.95, increments = NULL)

Arguments

glm_model

(glm model object)
The model object can be all main effect model, and a model with one two-way interaction.
conf_level

(numeric value)
Confidence level for Wald odds ratio confidence interval.
increments

(named list)
Used to specify numeric values of continuous variables in glm_model which interact with other variables. This is used to calculate the odds ratio when comparing the other interaction variable effect. For example, for a model with ARM and AGE interaction, increments = list(AGE = c(18, 65)) will enable calculation of odds ratios of comparison ARM vs. reference ARM at AGE = 18 and AGE = 65. If increments = NULL, then default AGE value is ceiling of median.

Examples

library(random.cdisc.data)
library(dplyr)
library(purrr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘purrr’
#> The following object is masked from ‘package:testthat’:
#> 
#>     is_null

ADSL <- radsl(cached = TRUE)
ADSL <- ADSL %>% mutate(
 SEX = as.character(SEX),
 SEX = case_when(!SEX %in% c("F", "M") ~ "U",
               TRUE ~ SEX))
ADRS <- radrs(ADSL, seed = 2)
ADRS_f <- subset(ADRS, PARAMCD == "BESRSPI") %>%
  mutate(Response = case_when(AVALC %in% c("PR", "CR") ~ 1,
                              TRUE ~ 0))
glm_model <- glm(
 formula = Response ~ ARM + AGE + SEX + ARM*SEX,
 data = ADRS_f,
 family = "binomial")
s_logistic_interaction(glm_model, conf_level = 0.90)
#> $N
#> [1] 400
#> 
#> $results
#> $results$ARM
#> $results$ARM$main
#>     df    p-value
#> ARM  2 5.5352e-07
#> 
#> $results$ARM$predictor
#> $results$ARM$predictor$term_type
#> [1] "categorical"
#> 
#> $results$ARM$predictor$interact_with
#> [1] "SEX"
#> 
#> $results$ARM$predictor$counts_by_level
#> 
#>      A: Drug X     B: Placebo C: Combination 
#>            134            134            132 
#> 
#> $results$ARM$predictor$term_ref_level
#> [1] "A: Drug X"
#> 
#> $results$ARM$predictor$term_comp_level
#> [1] "B: Placebo"     "C: Combination"
#> 
#> 
#> $results$ARM$summary
#> $results$ARM$summary$`B: Placebo`
#> $results$ARM$summary$`B: Placebo`$summary_comp_level
#>                    coef        se      p-value df
#> ARMB: Placebo -2.112618 0.5168627 4.362577e-05  1
#> 
#> $results$ARM$summary$`B: Placebo`$summary_with_interaction
#> $results$ARM$summary$`B: Placebo`$summary_with_interaction$F
#>         or        lcl       ucl
#> 1 0.120921 0.05167498 0.2829586
#> 
#> $results$ARM$summary$`B: Placebo`$summary_with_interaction$M
#>          or        lcl       ucl
#> 1 0.2368396 0.09433993 0.5945836
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> $results$ARM$summary$`C: Combination`
#> $results$ARM$summary$`C: Combination`$summary_comp_level
#>                        coef        se   p-value df
#> ARMC: Combination 0.4825163 0.7522984 0.5212696  1
#> 
#> $results$ARM$summary$`C: Combination`$summary_with_interaction
#> $results$ARM$summary$`C: Combination`$summary_with_interaction$F
#>         or       lcl      ucl
#> 1 1.620146 0.4700556 5.584177
#>

#> 1 0.722718 0.243608 2.144106

#>         or       lcl      ucl

#>

#>          or       lcl      ucl
#> 1 0.6596851 0.1811945 2.401753
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> $results$`ARM:SEX`

#>         df p-value
#> ARM:SEX  2 0.53082
#> 
#> $results$`ARM:SEX`$predictor

#> [1] "interaction"
#> 
#> 
#> $results$`ARM:SEX`$summary
#>                                    coef        se   p-value df
#> B: Placebo * M , n = 52      0.67224576 0.7609838 0.3770254  1
#> C: Combination * M , n = 62 -0.09125649 1.0260777 0.9291318  1
#> 
#> 
#> 
glm_model2 <- glm(
 formula = Response ~ ARM + AGE + ARM*AGE,
 data = ADRS_f,
 family = "binomial")
s_logistic_interaction(glm_model2, conf_level = 0.90)

glm_model3 <- glm(
 formula = Response ~ ARM + AGE + BMRKR1 + BMRKR1*AGE,
 data = ADRS_f,
 family = "binomial")
s_logistic_interaction(glm_model3 , conf_level = 0.90)
